result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy R Hines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: case 14CF4899, but consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment.  All court costs, surcharges and assessments.
If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Complete a high school diploma if possible, otherwise obtain GED/HSED.  Maintain fulltime employment, if in school part time then work part time; if in school ful time then work part time.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealing.
No contact with Sydney C., Anthony C., Marvel J., Larry S., Shawn H. and Absalom L.
Court will allow for expungement if the defendant is in complete compliance with the sentence.

Cooperate with agent.
Cognitive thinking program.
AODA asessment and recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  No drugs or alcohol.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy R Hines

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order Commuting Probation Term received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probationary term.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 12 days credit CONCURRENT to case #14CF4899 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Conditions of probation,
-No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding
-Cooperate with agent
-Absolute sobriety; no drugs or alcohol
-Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing
-AODA assessment and recommended treatment
-Complete a high school diploma is possible, otherwise obtain GED/HSED
-Maintain full-time employment, if in school part-time then work part-time, if in school full-time then work part-time
-Cognitive thinking program
-No contact with Sydney C., Anthony C., Marvel J., Larry S., Shawn H., and Absalom I.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1,000 payable to Sydney and Anthony C. was set in case #14CF4899, the cash bail on deposit in this matter is to be applied to the restitution set in the aforementioned case
All court costs, surcharges, and assessments; 
-If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges, assessments and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court will allow for expungement if the defendant is in complete compliance with the sentence.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tommy R Hines in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Defendant Tommy R Hines in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tommy R Hines in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Defendant Tommy R Hines in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.
As to Count 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing on today.  Defense unable to proceed as the defendant has missed office appointments.  Defendant admonished by the Court.  The state has no objection to defense request for adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Tommy R Hines in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/18/15.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
